gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Water Level Rivers 2002-present (vector), global, per overpass - version 2

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Water Level is defined as the height, in meters above the geoid, of the reflecting surface of continental water bodies. It is observed by space radar altimeters that measure the time it takes for radar pulses to reach the ground targets, directly below the spacecraft (nadir position), and return. Hence, only water bodies located along the satellite's ground tracks can be monitored, with a quality of measurement that not only depends of the size of the water body, but also on the reflecting targets in its surroundings such as topography or vegetation. Water Level is computed as time series over lakes and at the intersections of rivers and the satellite ground tracks.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global component of Land Service of the Copernicus programme. It can be also useful for all applications related to the environment monitoring.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Water Level products were generated by the Global Land Service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The product is based on POSEIDON data from JASON2 & JASON3 (copyright EUMETSAT, CNES, NOAA and NASA).

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: European Commission Directorate-General for Internal Market, Industry, Entrepreneurship and SMEs
European Commission Directorate-General Joint Research Centre

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gmd:specification.gco:CharacterString: geospatial data interchange format based on JavaScript Object Notation

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Free by ftp and EUMETCast; cost of medium by DvD or tape

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe, Africa and Latin-America. When ordering products from the online archive or subscribing to receive future products, users are informed via e-mail whenever the requested products are ready to be downloaded on the FTP server.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: 1. Search, download and custom order products from Catalogue and Ordering services
2. Subscribe to receive future products via e-mail
3. Register to receive products via EUMETCast

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines
INSPIRE Data Specification on Hydrography - Guidelines

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: Altimeter measurements are extracted over each satellite ground track with both a land/water mask and predefined editing criteria on the values of the altimeter range and associated propagation corrections. From these computed along-track water levels, outliers are rejected by Standard Deviation test and an average water level is computed. A final selection step ensures consistency of the most recently computed water level value with the existing water level time series. The input data are the 9 years Top measured by the POSEIDON sensor.
